channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Live Emmys 2024: 'The Bear' leads the pack at TV's biggest night
item.description: Eugene and Dan Levy are hosting the 76th Primetime Emmy Awards Sunday night. We'll be following along with the winners here.
item.content:encoded:
Eugene and Dan Levy are hosting the 76th Primetime Emmy Awards Sunday night. We'll be following along with the winners here.

(Image credit: Robyn Beck)
item.dc:creator: Chloee Weiner

item.title: Trump is safe after shots fired in apparent 'attempted assassination' in Florida
item.description: A suspect was about 300 to 500 yards from former President Donald Trump on Sunday afternoon, pointing a rifle through the fence of Trump’s golf club in West Palm Beach, Fla., local authorities said.
item.content:encoded:
A suspect was about 300 to 500 yards from former President Donald Trump on Sunday afternoon, pointing a rifle through the fence of Trump’s golf club in West Palm Beach, Fla., local authorities said.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: Luke Garrett

item.title: Trump says 'I hate Taylor Swift' after pop star endorses Harris
item.description: The Republican presidential nominee directed his vitriol at the pop star after Swift threw her support behind the Democratic presidential nominee.
item.content:encoded:
The Republican presidential nominee directed his vitriol at the pop star after Swift threw her support behind the Democratic presidential nominee.

(Image credit: Dimitrios Kambouris)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: Top legal adviser to New York City mayor quits as investigations swell
item.description: The top legal adviser to New York City Mayor Eric Adams resigned over the weekend, the latest sign of instability in the Democrat's administration as it deals with multiple federal investigations.
item.content:encoded:
The top legal adviser to New York City Mayor Eric Adams resigned over the weekend, the latest sign of instability in the Democrat's administration as it deals with multiple federal investigations.

(Image credit: Richard Drew)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Vance defends spreading claims that Haitian migrants are eating pets
item.description: Sen. JD Vance, in a media appearance, blames the media for ignoring the situation in Springfield, Ohio, and justifies false stories about Haitian migrants.
item.content:encoded:
Sen. JD Vance, in a media appearance, blames the media for ignoring the situation in Springfield, Ohio, and justifies false stories about Haitian migrants.

(Image credit: Steve Helber)
item.dc:creator: Luke Garrett

item.title: As medical strike drags on in South Korea, patients are on edge
item.description: Seven months have passed since South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol announced a plan to increase the number of doctors. Trainee doctors walked off their jobs in protest and they haven’t returned.
item.content:encoded:
Seven months have passed since South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol announced a plan to increase the number of doctors. Trainee doctors walked off their jobs in protest and they haven’t returned.

(Image credit: Jung Yeon-Je)
item.dc:creator: Se Eun Gong

item.title: Torrential rains trigger mass evacuations as rivers surge in Central Europe
item.description: Torrential rains in Central Europe have forced massive evacuations in the hardest hit areas in the Czech Republic, where floods reached extreme levels on Sunday.
item.content:encoded:
Torrential rains in Central Europe have forced massive evacuations in the hardest hit areas in the Czech Republic, where floods reached extreme levels on Sunday.

(Image credit: Petr David Josek)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Creative ways communities are reducing food waste
item.description: While lots of powerful changes to reduce food waste can start at home, sometimes the scale of the problem benefits from a community-wide approach.
item.content:encoded:
While lots of powerful changes to reduce food waste can start at home, sometimes the scale of the problem benefits from a community-wide approach.

(Image credit: Justin Sullivan)
item.dc:creator: The NPR Network

item.title: Not sure what to make for dinner? Here are recipes to help you eat sustainably
item.description: Finding meals that are good for you, your wallet and the environment can be difficult. We've pulled together a few recipes to make sustainable choices even easier.
item.content:encoded:
Finding meals that are good for you, your wallet and the environment can be difficult. We've pulled together a few recipes to make sustainable choices even easier.

(Image credit: Donald Bowers)
item.dc:creator: The NPR Network

item.title: How do you help young Afghan refugees heal? A new program in Maine offers a way
item.description: Research shows that a toxic mix of past traumas and the stresses of resettlement puts refugee kids at significantly higher risk of long term mental health challenges. A new effort aims to mitigate those risks by supporting parents and children in refugee families.
item.content:encoded:
Research shows that a toxic mix of past traumas and the stresses of resettlement puts refugee kids at significantly higher risk of long term mental health challenges. A new effort aims to mitigate those risks by supporting parents and children in refugee families.

(Image credit: Raquel C. Zaldívar)
item.dc:creator: Rhitu Chatterjee
